member.summary: Adds a service that allows creating instances of using configuration defined by . These services will use Azure Application Insights.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryClientServiceCollectionExtensions.AddAzureInsightsTelemetryClient(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions})

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions
member.summary: Defines the options used to configure new instances.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.InstrumentationKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the instrumentation key. Without the instrumentation key the telemetry will not be collected. The default value is null.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether telemetry is enabled. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.IgnoreErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether any error raised by the telemetry features should be ignored (not thrown). Default value is true.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.DeveloperMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether telemetry should be collected in developer mode. The default value is false. When true the telemetry is expedited through the pipeline immediately.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.EnableAdaptiveSampling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether adaptive sampling is enabled. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.DefaultProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a dictionary containing the properties that should be added to telemetry requests.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.RequestTracking
member.summary: Gets or sets additional request tracking options.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.AzureInsightsTelemetryOptions.TelemetryChannel
member.summary: Gets or sets the concrete telemetry channel that should be used. The default value is null. If null, the default telemetry channel will be used.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the all the request headers for all requests should be tracked. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.RequestTrackingOptions.TrackResponseHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the all the response headers for all requests should be tracked. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.RequestTrackingOptions.IgnoreAvailabilityTestsRequests
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether availability tests requests should be ignored (not collected). The default value is false.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.DefaultPropertiesTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a telemetry initializer (see ) that ensures the telemetry items context includes the global properties specified in .
member.remarks: This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default in .

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.HeadersTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines the base class for request telemetry initializers (see ) that initialize properties based on the request or response headers.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.HeadersTelemetryInitializer.Headers
member.summary: Gets or sets how the initializer should track headers.
member.remarks: If the initializer will not track any header. If the initializer will track all headers. If the initializer will track only the headers whose name match the specified .

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.HeadersTelemetryInitializer.HeaderNames
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of the names of the headers that the initializer should track. The specified may path may use glob pattern matching ().

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.HeadersTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.HeadersTelemetryInitializerBehavior
member.summary: Defines the behavior of a .

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.HeadersTelemetryInitializerBehavior.All
member.summary: The initializer will track all headers.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.HeadersTelemetryInitializerBehavior.None
member.summary: The initializer will not track any headers.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.HeadersTelemetryInitializerBehavior.Specified
member.summary: The initializer will track only the headers whose name match the specified header names.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestHeadersTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry initializer (see ) that allows collecting request headers.
member.remarks:
This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default, if is true, in
to track all request headers for all requests.
member.example:
To track all request headers for all requests:
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, RequestHeadersTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestHeadersTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines the base class for telemetry initializers (see ) that initialize properties for requests telemetry.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializer.Requests
member.summary: Gets or sets how the initializer should track requests.
member.remarks: If the initializer will not be executed for any request. If the initializer will be executed for all requests. If the initializer will be executed for the requests whose path match the specified .

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializer.RequestPaths
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of request paths for which the initializer will be executed. The specified may path may use glob pattern matching ().

member.summary: Gets the service provider.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializer.ShouldInitialize(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DataContracts.RequestTelemetry)
member.summary: Determines whether the telemetry initializer should be executed for the specified request telemetry.
member.returns: A value indicating whether the telemetry initializer should be executed for the specified request telemetry.
member.remarks: This method is called by to determine whether should be called. The default behavior is to check the request path only.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializer.InitializeCore(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DataContracts.RequestTelemetry)
member.summary: Executes the request initializer for the specified request telemetry.
member.remarks: This method is called by if returns true.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializerBehavior
member.summary: Defines the behavior of a .

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializerBehavior.All
member.summary: The initializer will be executed for all requests.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializerBehavior.None
member.summary: The initializer will not be executed for any requests.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.RequestTelemetryInitializerBehavior.Specified
member.summary: The initializer will be executed only for the requests whose path match the specified paths.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.ResponseHeadersTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry initializer (see ) that allows collecting response headers.
member.remarks:
This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default if is true, in
to track all response headers for all requests.
member.example:
To track all response headers for all requests:
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, ResponseHeadersTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.ResponseHeadersTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.StatusCodeTelemetryInitializer
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry initializer (see ) that allows setting a request as success based on a given status code for a specific request path.
member.remarks:
By default, Application Insights will treat 404 responses as failures and that may trigger alerts and other healing mechanisms that will not be correct/effective when the application is expected to return those responses (like is the case of Web API routes). Changing the request telemetry result (success/failure) based on the response status code allows to change that behavior. This type should be registered as a singleton before . This telemetry initializer is configured by default if is true, in
to track all response headers for all requests.
member.example:
To set all responses to success, regardless of the request path:
services.AddSingleton<ITelemetryInitializer, StatusCodeTelemetryInitializer>();

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.StatusCodeTelemetryInitializer.StatusCode
member.summary: Gets or sets the status code for which the requests will be set as success. The default value is .

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Initializers.StatusCodeTelemetryInitializer.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.Telemetry.Azure.Processors.IgnoreAvailabilityRequestTelemetryProcessor
member.summary: Defines a request telemetry processor (see ) that prevents request telemetry resulting from availability tests from being collected.
member.remarks: This type should be registered AFTER . This telemetry initializer is configured by default if is true, in .
member.example:
To ignore all availability tests requests, regardless of the request path:
services.AddApplicationInsightsTelemetryProcessor<IgnoreAvailabilityRequestTelemetryProcessor>();

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The next processor in the pipeline.
